Reviews.Title: You can buy this phone for so much cheaper!!!
Reviews.Author: Sean
Reviews.Content: Hey guys just to let you know you can buy this phone from the ATT website for $7.99 as a Gophone. Yes you read that correctly $7.99! You don't sign a contract or anything and  you can just put your ATT sim card in there.

Reviews.Title: great and cool phone for a decent price
Reviews.Author: R. Adimulam "ren adi"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this for my dad and he just loves it, its easy to use and access, with most of the basic features of a smartphone, this is a decent phone. Battery back up is great and this phone looks and feels very nice.

Reviews.Title: Great basic phone
Reviews.Author: Riderchap
Reviews.Content: I needed a cell phone with the just the basic functionality and a good battery life. I am happy I found this. Clear call clarity, good battery life (compared to other phones I've used) a solid feel in hand yet compact.

Reviews.Title: Better than my $300 Samsung
Reviews.Author: J. Ashworth "Julie"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a light-weight phone with a FM radio. This Nokia has good reception w/ T-mobile, and the volume is good. The best feature is the FM radio. The antenna provided by Nokia is weak, so I recommend using an alternate - any 2.5mm headset will work fine. Just for comparison, I spent $300 on my previous phone, a light-weight Samsung phone w/ FM radio. I was disappointed with the Samsung - the phone itself was fine, but it used proprietary adaptors limiting my headset options. I bought 3 Samsung headsets, and all produced too much static for the FM radio to be useful.

Reviews.Title: Nokia
Reviews.Author: Ivan Aguirre
Reviews.Content: A very nice phone to have. Nothing complicate it. Nokia makes very nice phones.Nokia'sphones are cool,. This one in particular I personally think that is the bestmodel.

Reviews.Title: Can hardly believe this is an old phone
Reviews.Author: James Nicholas Ahern "Nerd Bag Tech-Support"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone because I needed a solid battery life and talking phone for college. I also purchased this phone because it works with the Nokia PC Suite software, which allows me to control the phone from my computer for tasks such as writing SMS messages and managing my contacts. This phone has bluetooth which works wonderfully. I've tested the range of the bluetooth to be about 17 feet. It is very reliable and I have not had any disconnect issues with the bluetooth. The camera on this phone is quite basic, but it works if you are willing to wait for it to load. I was shocked how wonderful the phone was when I opened the box. You get a pair of headphones and a charger with the phone when you purchase it.

Reviews.Title: good non data phone
Reviews.Author: jdogg
Reviews.Content: If you're not a believer in data plans like me this phone is for you. Very similar to 1680. Only thing that annoyed me is the web2go shortcut key right above the end call button. This key can NOT be changed. Other than that very simple/basic phone.

Reviews.Title: Good Phone for The Price
Reviews.Author: Richmael Padmore "Rmael"
Reviews.Content: This phone does all I expect of it for the price. I bought this as a temporary phone & it did a satisfactory job; no drop calls & a clear enough signal.

Reviews.Title: Good quality, nice package
Reviews.Author: Grace
Reviews.Content: The quality is good, as an used cell phone with a low price, the quality exceeds my expecation.Good package. What's more, a additional charger is provided, which give me a surprise !Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Used to like the old Nokia-
Reviews.Author: M. Labadie "Atlantic"
Reviews.Content: Was excited when I saw the old NOKIA and removed it from package and though out the box. Bought for my mom who just wanted to replace an old basic phone- Bought phone because it said it was unlocked as I wanted to send to another country. Turns out that she has to pay to unlock this phone and it will only work on one of the networks which is the one she is not signed up with. This is disappointing as she has to spend more money to buy another phone.

Reviews.Title: a real smart phone
Reviews.Author: God is a refuge for us (Psalms 62:8)
Reviews.Content: Okay, so technically, it is not a "smart" phone.  But there are so many "pros" to this phone that I think it's a really smart buy.Easy to use.Readable display.Durable.Lots of features (calendar, calculator, to-do list, alarm clock, etc.)Small.Great battery life.Inexpensive.Unlocked (so you can use it with any GSM cell phone company).Ability to set volume.Speaker phone.Camera.Voice recorder.Programmable ring profiles.Configurable buttons.You can also download Nokia PC Suite software from Nokia, and use bluetooth to backup your phone settings and address book.  In case you're looking for it, there is NO phone-to-PC data cable for this phone.For full spec's and features, do a search online by model # to see the long list.I've used this phone for several years, and it works great for me.I don't text, so my experience with the phone is voice only.I don't recommend it for surfing the web or email.So, if you are looking for a PHONE (the kind you talk on), then this phone is hard to beat.Looking for an inexpensive and reliable cell phone company?Try PlatinumTel (also known as PTel).They are a GSM virtual carrier that uses the T-Mobile network.Prepaid.5-cents a minute; minimum of $5 a month.And they have other plans for people who talk/text more often.Check-out their terms/service agreement for details.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Colin
Reviews.Content: Product for the money. Works with sim card. Cannot recieve pictures tho from a third party even though The phone can take pictures. very odd. Ah well.

Reviews.Title: Couple important details not in the reviews below from ...
Reviews.Author: B-Dub
Reviews.Content: Matthew and Vik:At least at present in my state, when you order the phone as a GoPhone at the AT&T; site, they will tack on tax based on what they say is the full retail value of the phone, so that added $14 or so to make it a $23 phone. Yes, that's still better than buying it unlocked elsewhere, but should be kept in mind when comparing to other phones you are considering.  Go through the purchase process to screen where you enter credit card details and look at the price at the very bottom of the page to see what tax they will charge. Some people may not even notice that it gets added in there.Secondly, if you go with the refurbished version to save a few bucks, realize that you get a much shorter warranty period (90 days) on a phone that may have had technical issues once already rather than the full year warranty that applies to a new one.We bought the precursor to this model, the 2320, for our middle school student. However, I wanted one with Bluetooth to use as a back up for my own phone or to give to our other kid as needed, and it serves the purpose well. The 2320 was just $15 at retailers near us (with tax on the $15 only) and came with $15 worth of minutes to make it virtually free.  I made the mistake of putting my SIM card in it first before activating to see if it would work for me, and so the $15 credit was added to my normal plan account as extra minutes.  Unfortunately, I don't need them since I never use up my rollover supply, but so be it.We get pretty good reception on both these phones and when my kid calls, he sounds fine (San Fran Bay area).

Reviews.Title: loved it
Reviews.Author: Tahsin Mowla
Reviews.Content: it was small, easy to use and very useful for international travelling. the sim changing part was very easy while on journey!

Reviews.Title: phone is locked with other network provider. I cant use the phone with my international sim card. please send unlocking code. pl
Reviews.Author: Deep Cover
Reviews.Content: phone is locked with other network provider. I cant use the phone with my international sim card. please send unlocking code. please. the advertisement says unlock.. please provide me an unlocking code..thnks

Reviews.Title: Solid Phone but no Flashlight or accessories.
Reviews.Author: T. Prentice "TP"
Reviews.Content: This is a very good, simple and functional phone. Nokia always makes strong and reliable phones. The only problem I have with it, the description says that the phone has a flashlight and radio but does have a flashlight and to use the radio you need a headset, I don't know if is because I received the T-Mobile version or because of the seller. Otherwise than that, the phone has good battery life, very clear headset speaker and back speaker is pretty loud, screens real bright and clear along with good display of colors. Ships fast and received fast even on standard shipping got the phone in 2days. This is really good for traveling and if you work challenge jobs, so you don't need to fiddle through menus and apps like a smart phone.

Reviews.Title: Simple to use but some diffiucty to hear voices
Reviews.Author: kkp
Reviews.Content: I like its simplicity to use which is exactly what I wanted to have. However, sometimes there is difficult in hearing voices.

Reviews.Title: no flashlight
Reviews.Author: Rupee
Reviews.Content: This phone says it has  flashlight but it doesnt and when i received the package it wasnt the s40 version it just said nokia 2330. so i returned it.

Reviews.Title: Not Unlocked
Reviews.Author: Allan
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of them from Amazon. I received them but they were not unlocked, I had to pay separately to unlock them.Besides this, the phone is fine. Very basic, but is what I need for a low price.Update:After using the phone for 1 month, I meet my expectations. The signal is good, the volume is great, and the phone looks very good, not cheap made. The camera is not powerful, but anyway I see it as a plus. The radio works fine. If you want a phone that works good for SMS and calls, and do not want to spend more than $50, I think this is the best you can get for the price.

Reviews.Title: Lousy purchase
Reviews.Author: L. Exum
Reviews.Content: I purchased this from the ATT website for about $80 (after all taxes and fees) a year ago.  I have no need for a smart phone.  I have pretty low expectations in a phone and read reviews in advance.  Unfortunately, I didn't find many at that time.  After using for a year, I can say this is just a lousy phone.  My biggest complaint is that I have a lot of difficulty hearing people when they are speaking and am frequently apologizing and asking people to repeat themselves.  My second biggest peeve is that even basic functions, such as changing the ring type (from ring to vibrate, for instance), is a process that involves 3 different menu screens.  And forget changing the ring volume.  As expected, the camera quality is poor.  Save yourself some hassle and avoid this phone.

Reviews.Title: Fair product.
Reviews.Author: Nadar
Reviews.Content: I had purchased this as a gift for my father-in-law back in India. My wife used it for few mots as our secondary phone. The speakers are not that loud enough to notice a incoming call.The build quality is ok as expected from Nokia.Unfortunately this product did not work in India due to band difference and now it is used as a paper weight in India.

Reviews.Title: I hate it.
Reviews.Author: khanh
Reviews.Content: it is not a unlocked phone ! only works for T mobile. I went to walmart and bought an Att sim card but it didnt work.

Reviews.Title: Great temporary phone
Reviews.Author: Matthew Siebert "~Author and Critic"
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a back-up phone becase my main phone's battery is going out. I bought this phone from ATT "refurbished" for an astounding 5.32 with two day shipping. Yes that is right, 5 dollars and 32 cents with 2-day shipping.Note that this is advertised as a pre-paid phone but it works as a normal phone too. I switched the sim card out of my older phone into this one and it works like a charm with my current plan.So given the fact that the phone is 5.32 you shoudlnt be expecting an Apple iPhone or Blackberry. But it does have blue tooth and a camera. So the 4 stars is for the price and use to make / receive calls. If your an avid texter or like to surf the net, this will be a pain to use. This phone will definitely last me a couple months until I get a new contract.Oh, and even though its advertised as "refurbished", mine arrived in immaculate condition. Comes with box, instructions, charger, battery, everything. No complaints from me.

Reviews.Title: Do not work =(
Reviews.Author: Moises Duran
Reviews.Content: I have I very good review for the Milestone, but this another was a gift (for someone that cannot use a smartphone)But this just start the logo and then goes out!sorry for my english =P

Reviews.Title: Even if all you want is a phone, why this one?
Reviews.Author: Tsung
Reviews.Content: This Nokia 2330 (2330c-2b) can only work as the very basic of a phone, a candy-bar style phone. It only supports GSM dual bands (850/1900) that can only be used in USA and Canada while a lot other phones, even the very basic models, support GSM 4 bands (850/900/1800/1900) that can be used worldwide. Its camera is the one with the lowest resoultion you can find in the market nowaday. It uses poor VGA (480x640) quality in 0.3 mega pixel, and its video uses only six frames per second in 128x96 resolution. To make it even worse, the photos and videos it took are unfocused, full with noise and strange colors. It comes with a low 32M shared internal memory and it does not allow you to use an external memory card to expand. Due to the very small memory, the music player is basicly cannot be used. In addition, the junk files (the demo games), weblinks, some built-in wallpapers, tone rings, and themes are all system files which cannot be deleted, that only left with about 4M free memory. Even by using "Mobile Media Browser" software to delete those "system" games, themes, and some ringtones, that will gain some more free space, it still has only about 8M free memory. Hence, you can only use it as a phone, period. (However, it does come with a FM radio.) I feel that the 1.75 inch screen (with resolution of 128x160) should be a little up to allow more room for the very small keypad, which is hard to do text messaging. The phone did freeze couple times in my experience that is at least a basic phone should not happen in any case. I had to remove the battery to shut it down. The battery standby time is so-so that only lasting about five days with some occasional using. Even if all you need is a simple phone, why this one?

Reviews.Title: The worst phone I have ever had to use.
Reviews.Author: Dee Mess
Reviews.Content: My beloved Nokia 6301 crapped out on me, after almost a year, so I was forced to use this 2330 model, which was acquired at the same time as the 6301, but was not being used.And for such a small phone, it sure is a big piece of crap.I had unknowingly purchased a "refurbished" 6301 model. It was not made clear on the TMobile website what a "refurbished" phone is--if you don't know, a "refurbished" phone is a USED phone. If I had known that, I would have bought a NEW 6301.The sound is terrible. The person I'm talking to sounds like they're using a tin can with a piece of string attached, and I'm told that they have trouble hearing me on their end, no matter what kind of phone they're on.The screen is so inferior, compared to the large, bright, clear screen on the 6301--I have to hold the phone at an angle to see what's on the screen, and it is very dark; any picture you might have on the wallpaper is pixellated.Speaking of wallpaper--I can set a slide show, like on my 6301, but there isn't a feature to have a screensaver once the screen goes dark--VERY disappointing.The memory's not that great, either; and if I could delete the pictures and sounds and message templates that came with the phone, I'd have more memory for my own pictures and sounds (it's MY phone, is it not?)... unfortunately, this seems to be a feature on TMobile phones that the person who purchases the phone has no say in.I hate this phone so much!! If I could find another 6301 ANYWHERE, I'd buy it in a second, no matter what the cost--it was the best phone I've ever had. The 2330 is a piece of junk I wouldn't give to a 10-year old.

Reviews.Title: nokia phone
Reviews.Author: Dan M.
Reviews.Content: walmart used to sell this on tmobile network for 20 bucks i bought 3 of them but wife washed them in my work pants, now i see $50 bucks i want this phone i have 3 phones new battery but i wont pay $50 bucks for a $20 buck  phone, its a cheap ass phone with great features mostly fm radio you cant have with most stupid or i mean smartphones  id pay $50 bucks but i wont and walmart dont sell it anymore atleast for tmobile

Reviews.Title: Not the right item, and broken....
Reviews.Author: kgutie11
Reviews.Content: I am not sure if it was a fluke or if it happens often but I ordered a phone, when it arrived it was not the correct phone.  The phone that was sent is definately nicer but it had no backing to hold the sim/battery in... Not sure what happened but I am def. not pleased with this.  I automatically was sent instructions for mailing the item back which now I have to pay for shipping and handling again for this phone and then hopefully I will get my money back.. We will see. I have never had this happen before and shop often on Amazon as a prime member.

Reviews.Title: Great for a temporary phone - can last 3 months, sometimes more!
Reviews.Author: G. Butler
Reviews.Content: Product is slow responding to key presses, taking a second or longer.  On occasion will disable screen saver mode.  Whatever you do when this happens is do not let it run out the charge, you will brick your unit and it will be unrecoverable short of sending it in.  This device has been enough for me to swear off of all Nokia products forever, that's how bad it's been.  I wouldn't use this POS as my primary phone if they paid me 100 large.

Reviews.Title: Piece of Junk
Reviews.Author: M. L. "my opinion"
Reviews.Content: This is the worst phone I have ever used.  It does only the most basic of functions and it doesn't even do them well.  Mine stopped charging within the first 30 days.  It's now dead.  I don't recommend this one for anyone except Jason Bourne.  Use it once and lose it.

Reviews.Title: Yes, I have received the right Stuff!
Reviews.Author: MANUEL ZAPATA "SeGbaS"
Reviews.Content: Today I inquire about that I have not receive the item yet; but wait no need to sent another order, because it was not lost in transit. Mail-Box Etc. our carrier, send me an E-mail, arriving and confirm the cell phone and documents.Why?. It has a FLASHLIGHT. Thanks. Doctor.

ProductInfo.Features:
Lowest cost camera phone with bluetooth
Video recording
128 X 160, 65K Display
Xpress Audio Messaging
FM Radio
ProductInfo.Name: Nokia 2330C-2B With S40 Flashlight Unlocked Phone--US Version with Full Warranty
